settings

Class Setting

  • java.lang.Object
    • settings.Setting
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanSetting, ChoiceSetting, ColorSetting, DoubleSetting, FileSetting, FontColorSetting, IntegerSetting, LongSetting, MultipleLineStringSetting, SingleLineStringSetting

    public abstract class Setting
extends java.lang.Object

      • getValueClass

        public abstract java.lang.Class getValueClass()
        Returns the class type of the value being stored

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.Object obj)
              throws SettingException
        Sets the value, with some type checking. A set is expected to be done by the SettingOwner and so the owner notifySettingChanged method is not called. This will cause only the renderer to display the new value.
        Throws:
        SettingException

      • editValue

        public void editValue(java.lang.Object obj)
               throws SettingException
        Sets the value, with some type checking. The edit is expected to be done either by one of the editors, or by an object that is not the SettingOwner. Therefore, the SettingOwner will be notified and the renderer will display the new value.
        Throws:
        SettingException

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enable)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.lang.String key)

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey()

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Must be overridden to define what this setting should be written like to a file, so that it can be read in again
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • parseStringValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object parseStringValue(java.lang.String string)
                                           throws SettingException
        Must be overridden to return an object of the appropriate type, which is a parsed version of the string.
        Throws:
        SettingException
